title: 1360 ESLint warnings (0 errors) across root codebase
description: ESLint reports 1360 warnings with 0 errors. Majority are: security/detect-non-literal-fs-filename (expected in Node.js scripts), unused eslint-disable directives, and complexity warnings. 10 warnings are auto-fixable.
evidence: 0 errors and 10 warnings potentially fixable with --fix
recommendation: Run eslint --fix for 10 auto-fixable warnings. Triage remaining by category: suppress detect-non-literal-fs-filename for scripts/ via eslint config, remove unused disable directives.
suggested_fix: Run eslint --fix for 10 auto-fixable warnings. Triage remaining by category.
suggestion_text: Accept at S2. Zero errors is good. Warnings are mostly noise from security plugin on internal scripts.
counter_argument: 1360 warnings create alert fatigue and hide real issues.

title: functions/src/admin.ts has 1 ESLint error — unused variable _startTimeMillis
description: Cloud Functions lint fails with 1 error: '_startTimeMillis' is assigned a value but never used in admin.ts:2163. This blocks functions CI lint step.
evidence: 2163:15 error '_startTimeMillis' is assigned a value but never used @typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars
cd functions && npm run lint exits with code 1
recommendation: Remove the unused _startTimeMillis assignment or use the variable for timing metrics as intended.

evidence_collected: cd functions && npm run lint → 2163:15 error _startTimeMillis is assigned a value but never used

suggested_fix: Remove the unused _startTimeMillis assignment or use the variable for timing metrics as intended.
suggestion_text: Accept at S1. This is a lint error (not warning) that would block CI. Quick fix.
counter_argument: Prefixed with _ which conventionally means intentionally unused, but ESLint config doesn't exempt it.

title: 30 markdownlint errors across docs/ — broken links, emphasis style, blockquote formatting
description: markdownlint reports 30 errors in docs: MD051 (broken link fragments in TESTING_PLAN.md, TRIGGERS.md), MD053 (unused link references in templates), MD049 (emphasis style in audit summaries), MD037 (space in emphasis), MD028 (blank line in blockquote in ROADMAP files).
recommendation: Fix broken link fragments first (most user-impactful), then emphasis/blockquote formatting. Template MD053 errors may need markdownlint-disable comments.
suggested_fix: Fix broken link fragments (#integration-testing-checklist etc), fix emphasis markers, fix blockquote formatting.
suggestion_text: Accept at S2. Broken link fragments are the most impactful.
counter_argument: Most are in rarely-read files. Templates use [brackets] as placeholder syntax.

title: 76 madge warnings during circular dependency check (no circular deps found)
description: madge reports 76 warnings while processing 164 files (likely unresolved imports or path aliases). No actual circular dependencies found.
suggested_fix: Investigate madge warnings — likely TypeScript path aliases or dynamic imports that madge can't resolve.
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. No actual circular deps. Warnings are likely false positives from path resolution.
counter_argument: 76 warnings means madge is only partially analyzing the dependency graph.

title: Pattern compliance --all reports 1137 new warnings across 29+ files
description: check-pattern-compliance.js --all detects 1137 warnings on first scan of all files. These are informational on first occurrence but will block on subsequent checks of the same file.
evidence: ⚠️ 1137 new warning(s) (first occurrence - fix before next check)
Files affected: hooks (17), skills (1), workflows (1), app components (5+), scripts (various)
suggested_fix: Triage by category: dismiss false positives (test files with mock API keys), fix encoding warnings, address real pattern violations.
suggestion_text: Accept at S3. First-scan noise. Many are false positives in test files.
counter_argument: 1137 warnings is excessive. Pattern compliance system may need tuning.
